pullRequest.body:
Homomorphisms of coalgebras, mimicking the file `Mathlib.Algebra.Algebra.Hom`.

---

I've left a few comments in the code on things I'm unsure of the purpose of. 

<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they

nodes.body:
Thanks a lot!

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8712584868/job/23899194711)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8712584868/job/23899193895)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8712584868/job/23899194192)
This all looks very uncontroversial to me. As you say, it's following Algebra.Algebra.Hom .
I should at some point try to revive #6791; new-style structures are just a waste of everyone's time for morphisms, where we always take everything apart and put it back together anyway.
Oh interesting! I hadn't realised that. So for morphisms the way we pack things up doesn't matter like it does for classes with data.
Basically no; the only thing we really do with morphisms is unfold them completely to their `toFun` field, at which point it doesn't matter how we put them together.
Can it? Then why isn't there a lint error?
Yep. I don't know why there isn't a lint error. I'll remove the `@[simp]` anyway.
Do you need these?
Nope. There are loads of similar `protected` theorems in `Algebra.Algebra.Hom` I chose not to emulate and I didn't intend to keep these ones in particular.
What does `to_ring` mean here (and below)?

Cos the codomain's the base ring. I think they were inspired by [`LinearMap.ext_ring`](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/e8433a6b8e7980bfaaf9b34513b77da2af14995a/Mathlib/Algebra/Module/LinearMap/Basic.lean#L497). Maybe `ext_counit` or something is better?
I think the current name is easier to find than `ext_counit`.
Are they?

Not as far as I can tell. Do you know why [these](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/e8433a6b8e7980bfaaf9b34513b77da2af14995a/Mathlib/Algebra/Algebra/Hom.lean#L134-L148) exist in `Algebra.Algebra.Hom`?
Complains why? Do you even need it?

LHS simplifies to `⇑f.toLinearMap`; indeed `simp` can prove it if I move it a few lines later (where the linter also doesn't complain if I tag it with `@[simp]`... I must've misunderstood simp linting). I'll remove this lemma.
